intro: Galium pseudoaristatum var. heuffelii, commonly known as the Heuffel's bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and native plant gardens.
